thread.title: SEBI raises minimum contract size in equity derivatives to Rs5 lakh
thread.title_full: SEBI raises minimum contract size in equity derivatives to Rs5 lakh

author: Moneylife Digital Team
title: SEBI raises minimum contract size in equity derivatives to Rs5 lakh
text: Moneylife Â» SEBI raises minimum contract size in equity derivatives to Rs5 lakh 42762 SEBI raises minimum contract size in equity derivatives to Rs5 lakh 0 Comments, Be the first to comment SEBI has raised minimum contract size for equity derivatives to Rs5 lakh from the next trading day after expiry of October 2015 contracts Market regulator Securities Exchange Board of India (SEBI) has raised the minimum contract size for equity derivatives to Rs5 lakh from Rs2 lakh earlier. In a notification, SEBI said, the new provision shall be made effective from the next trading day after expiry of October 2015 contracts.
